alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 08 at 2:48PM PST until March 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THURSDAY TO 10 PM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 15 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph along exposed ridges. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...From 3 PM Thursday to 10 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The higher peaks will have one to two feet of snow with this system.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades
